reviewText: Toby Ross takes you back to those long forgotten days. Nostalgia is the name of the game but with lots  cute guys with magnificent eye candy. Unfiltered  and uncensored with complete climax. A real surprise for me.
I love  this oldy but goody

A cute 1980 gay porno feature from Toby Ross which despite its many failings is oddly very appealing. In some ways it's a bit like a B-movie which you sometimes prefer to the main feature because of its limitations.  To be fair "Cruisin' 57" is no great shakes as a porno movie when judged against the William Higgins California beach boy extravaganzas which were about to swamp the scene. But the gangly crew of actors that Ross hired, do look like the guys down the street who may have been hanging out with your sister: a handsome bunch who look damn cute in and out of their groovy fifties gear. The sex scenes are okay if a bit on the clunky side: some of these dudes give the appearance of being a bit inexperienced with gay sex. There are some big cocks on display and the guys do keep solid erections during both oral and anal acts and as the box declares it "... features wonderfully messy cumshots."  It's all bareback as this film was made before condoms became the norm.  Oddly I didn't find the sex particularly erotic although the window jack-off scene was really well done with Ross showing a lot more panache. Ross, by the way, plays the role of the campy school teacher in the classroom.
And what a soundtrack! If you get tired of the action on the screen, just tune in to the groovy music that Ross culled from various radio stations of the time; sometimes it overwhelms the movie but as the dialog is fairly unintelligible you're not missing much.
If you can accept the obvious shortcomings of this little venture and just want to watch a quaint piece of gay porn nostalgia, you could do a lot worse than cruisin' this little sex romp.
